sentences.text: I don't have any sound in my Ubuntu.
I've updated my 9.10 version to this 10.4 beta, and with the previous release I didn't have any sound and that follows in the same way with the new Ubuntu.
and with it, there is no problem
Changed to PA since reporter said no sound in Ubuntu.
Please run the following command in terminal, this will provide more info for us to help find the problem for this bug.
RE: [Bug 554288] Re: no sound at all

RE: [Bug 554288] Re: no sound at all
There' s no novelty about my problem with sound.
Now, I've installed Lucid Lynx from zero but I don't have sound at all.
Curiously, I have installed too Ubuntu 10.4 in a Sun Virtualbox into the Windows partition in my computer and here, sound works.
> Subject: [Bug 554288] Re: no sound at all

> You received this bug notification because you are a direct subscriber
> of the bug.
> Status in firefox package in Ubuntu: New
> I don't have any sound in my Ubuntu.
I've updated my 9.10 version to this 10.4 beta, and with the previous release I didn't have any sound and that follows in the same way with the new Ubuntu.

and with it, there is no problem

_________________________________________________________________
Consejos para seducir Puedes conocer gente nueva a travs de Internet?
Fran, are you trying to get sound from the onboard soundcard or the USB sound card?
If it is the USB one, it's volume is muted.
RE: [Bug 554288] Re: no sound at all
> Subject: [Bug 554288] Re: no sound at all

> Fran, are you trying to get sound from the onboard soundcard or the USB
> sound card?
If it is the USB one, it's volume is muted.

> You received this bug notification because you are a direct subscriber
> of the bug.
> Status in alsa-driver package in Ubuntu: Incomplete
> I don't have any sound in my Ubuntu.
I've updated my 9.10 version to this 10.4 beta, and with the previous release I didn't have any sound and that follows in the same way with the new Ubuntu.

and with it, there is no problem
>
> AlsaVersion: Advanced Linux Sound Architecture Driver Version 1.0.21.

>  card 0: Intel [HDA Intel], device 0: ALC662 rev1 Analog [ALC662 rev1 Analog]
>    Subdevices: 1/1

USB Sound Device         at usb-0000:00:1d.1-2, full speed'
>    Mixer name	: 'USB Mixer'
>  Card hw:2 'HDMI'/'HDA ATI HDMI at 0xfdafc000 irq 17'
> To unsubscribe from this bug, go to:
Los que ya lo usan te los cuentan!
That the output volume for USB is muted?
Start gnome volume control through by right-clicking on the speaker icon, then select sound preferences, then the output tab.
